content: no sew amigurumi spider pattern materials these materials make a 4in l x 5 5in w x 2 5in h spider -yarn any size 4 yarn should work for this project i used red heart super saver yarn and i love this yarn you will one color for the body and a pink color for the cheeks if you want to embroider blush on them -4mm crochet hook -2 12mm safety eyes -needle for embroidery -polyfil for a large plush amigurumi spider you need these materials make an 8in l x 12in w x 5 in h spider -blanket yarn -18mm safety eyes -6mm crochet hook no sew amigurumi spider pattern© 2021 crochet by cassie babb chickinsoodlenoop abbreviations chain - chain double_crochet - double_crochet half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet slip_stitch - slip_stitch st - stitch single_crochet - single_crochet treble_crochet - triple crochet yo - yarn over legs make 8 row 1 chain 15 row 2 single_crochet into the second chain from the hook increase in each of the 13 remaining st fasten_off leaving a tail for tying before starting the body cut 2 14 inch pieces of yarn to crochet the spiders fangs later no sew amigurumi spider pattern© 2021 crochet by cassie babb chickinsoodlenoop body round 1 6 single_crochet in magic_ring 6 round 2 increase repeat 6 times 12 round 3 single_crochet in the next st increase repeat 6 times 18 round 4 single_crochet in the next 2 st increase repeat 6 times 24 round 5 single_crochet in the next 3 st increase repeat 6 times 30 rounds 6-8 single_crochet in all 30 st 30 round 9 single_crochet in the next 3 st decrease repeat 6 times 24 round 10 single_crochet in the next 2 st decrease repeat 6 times 18 round 11 single_crochet in the next 2 st increase repeat 6 times 24 round 12 single_crochet in the next 3 st increase repeat 6 times 30 round 13 single_crochet in the next 4 st increase repeat 6 times 36 rounds 14-18 single_crochet in all 36 st 36 now you can add your safety eyes and embroider the cheeks no sew amigurumi spider pattern© 2021 crochet by cassie babb chickinsoodlenoop for the fangs you will want to use a stitch marker to see if where you plan to stitch will be centered when it s done when your ready starting from the top of the head going down slip_stitch into the spot you marked then single_crochet in the same spot 3 times fasten_off pull the remaining yarn through the top hole to the bottom use your crochet hook to pull the remaining strands of yarn inside the spider for the legs use stitch markers to mark where the legs will go i use bobby pins which helps me get a good idea where they go since they re long in these pictures i only did one side but normally i do both to make sure they are even i space the legs out every 2 row like in the pictures below
